meanings.definition: Involving two or more academic disciplines
meanings.sent1: The interdisciplinary project combined science and art classes.
meanings.sent2: The university offers an interdisciplinary program that includes both history and psychology courses.
meanings.sent3: The interdisciplinary approach to learning made the students feel like they were in multiple places at once.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in an interdisciplinary way, connecting different subjects effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The interdisciplinary nature of the research allowed for a deeper understanding of the topic.

meanings.definition: Relating to or involving multiple fields or areas of study
meanings.sent1: The interdisciplinary conference brought together experts from various fields.
meanings.sent2: She pursued an interdisciplinary degree that combined biology and economics.
meanings.sent3: The interdisciplinary picnic had a mix of foods from different cuisines.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like an interdisciplinary web, connecting ideas from different subjects.
meanings.sent5: The interdisciplinary approach to problem-solving led to innovative solutions.
